briefTitle: Post-radiation Dental Disease Amongst Head and Neck Cancer Patients
officialTitle: The Effect of Dental and Salivary Gland Radiation Dose on the Occurrence of Post-radiotherapy Dental Disease in Patients With Head and Neck Cancer

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

\- Adult dentate patients diagnosed with a primary or secondary malignant tumour of the oral cavity, nasal cavity, sinuses, salivary glands, pharynx, or larynx\* requiring radiation treatment within Northern Ireland. \*International Classification of Diseases (ICD-10) codes C00.0-C14.8 and C30.0-32.9.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients deemed to have poor prognosis or to receive palliative treatment only (as advised by the Clinical Oncology team).
* Patients with less than 6 teeth before the radiotherapy start date.
* Patients with recurrent head and neck cancer, or patients receiving a repeat course of head and neck radiotherapy.
* Patients with diseases affecting tooth development (e.g. amelogenesis or dentinogenesis imperfecta) or salivary gland function (e.g. Sjogren's Syndrome).
* Patients with pre-existing trismus (mouth opening less than 35mm).

primary.description: The mean number of carious teeth amongst head and neck cancer patients post-radiotherapy

secondary.description: The proportion of head and neck cancer patients with periodontal disease post-radiotherapy.

secondary.measure: Xerostomia measured using the Xerostomia Questionnaire (XQ)
secondary.description: Change from baseline. Range of scores from 0 (no xerostomia) to 90 (worst xerostomia)
Change from baseline. 14 oral health problems presented - patients asked to score how often they are personally encountered (very often, fairly often, occasionally, hardly ever, never, don't know)

secondary.measure: Diet assessed by Question 13 of the World Health Organisation's Oral Health Questionnaire for Adults
secondary.description: Change from baseline. Respondents asked to detail how often they consume e.g. sugar buns

secondary.measure: Oral hygiene practice assessed by Questions 7,8,9 of the World Health Organisation's Oral Health Questionnaire for Adults
secondary.description: Change from baseline. Patients asked to indicate e.g. how often do you brush your teeth

secondary.measure: Costs of treatment to patients and NHS
